tags: also i'm still calling it the snap
i have seen other material calling it the decimation but i think the snap is better
so i'm going to call it that until i see how it plays out in the movie
summary: The Rest of the World After Endgame
title: The Rest of the World After Endgame
body:
I have spent most of my Endgame theorizing energy on the main characters in the MCU. I have also had a few background assumptions about what would happen after everything was resolved that I have remained confident in since shortly after Infinity War. 

My main assumption about the world as a whole is that everything would go back to normal after they reversed the Snap. I have been agnostic about whether the average person would remember the Snap, which I could see going either way, but I have been pretty certain that the majority of the damage would be undone along with the restoration of half the universe’s lifeforms. 

We’ve seen hints about the havoc that Snap has wreaked in the Endgame trailers and the AMATW post-credits scene. Such a drastic event would have to have large-scale consequences, but we haven’t really seen those effects on the general population in other MCU movies, aside from a few small mentions scattered throughout. Because the MCU has not liked to dwell on such things in the past, I assumed that part of the fix would be restore the pre-Snap status quo. 

But I saw a snippet of an interview that one of the writers gave to Empire, talking about how the loss and changes are real. Now, this could be in reference to the main heroes, but it got me thinking that it could also mean that however the Snap is reversed will not undo the large-scale changes that it caused in the world. That could be a super interesting plot thread going forward. 

As with every time I come up with another possibility for how Endgame might turn out, I just want to know what happens. It also always makes feel like I should give up because I always come back to the fact that I really have no idea what they’re going to do. This is only exacerbated by the Russos’ admission that they have used misleading footage in the trailers, which I should expect by now but still get fooled by. But speculating is fun, so I will probably keep doing it until the real end of the line.

summary: I have a problem... the only mcu movie I have seen is Captain Marvel but I wanna go see Endgame since she will be in it and the...
question: I have a problem... the only mcu movie I have seen is Captain Marvel but I wanna go see Endgame since she will be in it and the hype for it is off the charts. But I hate not understanding what's going on so like... what do I do??
answer:
Oh dear! Well the entire MCU is a tall order regardless of time crunch but you really have one lol. At least watch Infinity War obviously. But to be honest, the Infinity Saga (as these first 3 phases of the MCU are now known… 11 years and 22 films altogether I think) stretches out over all the films from the beginning and watching the majority of them would probably be best to get the full scope of the story and also it makes you understand and give a shit about the characters. The Incredible Hulk can be skipped, though.

Here is a guide to watching them chronologically in-universe. Though if you want to watch them in order of release that is easy enough to do.

And here is a handy link for info on different MCU things. It breaks some things down and has several links and lists.

You can also check out the MCU fandom/wikia for info.

Good luck and happy watching!

summary: About the whole Captain Marvel makeup thing...
title: About the whole Captain Marvel makeup thing...
body:
I’m a girl.
Sometimes I like putting on makeup.
And sometimes I just don’t feel like putting on makeup.
I like myself the way I am with or without makeup.
People shouldn’t judge other people (or characters for that matter) by when, why, how or how much makeup they have on their face, if any.

IT’S THEIR FUCKING FACE!

summary: I saw Captain Marvel for the third time yesterday (still great and I still cried, by the way), and all the theater employees...
body:
I saw Captain Marvel for the third time yesterday (still great and I still cried, by the way), and all the theater employees were wearing Endgame shirts. I just want the tickets to go on sale so I can give Marvel all my money.

33 days!

summary: There May Be a 22-Movie Marvel Marathon Coming on April 23rd
title: There May Be a 22-Movie Marvel Marathon Coming on April 23rd
body:
Last year, Marvel celebrated the 10th anniversary of Marvel Studios by returning all of the movies to theater over a multi-day marathon. According to theater listings that just popped up tonight; there may be another one this year to celebrate the grand conclusion of the 22-movie Infinity Saga in Avengers: Endgame.

Ezra on Twitteralerted me tonight to a listing that just appeared on the AMC…

View On WordPress

24. She/Her. Bi. 
A Few Fun Facts! 
I'm weird & too busy being myself to care what anyone else thinks, 
Needs coffee & books to survive, 
Likes cheesy jokes & bad puns, 
Adventurous & tired at the same time...
I love coming here cause my fandoms are what keep me going! So I share them here, so that maybe they can do the same for you! Feel free to shoot me a message here, I love talking to people & making friends!!!

tags: spider man: into the spider verse
body:
CableTV Marvel Movie Marathon

Though I know the chances are slim and there are thousands of valid candidates in the running, I am happy to announce I have submitted my name for the CableTV.com Marvel Movie Marathon! So if I could ask all of you for a favor and please share this spread the word, screenshot it, share on other social media…Facebook, Twitter, Instagram…I know it’s probably a really weird request, but this is something I am extremely excited and passionate about, and I want to share that with everybody! So pleaser feel free to click the follow button! I share new and exciting content every single day! Alright, thanks you guys! Love ya! 😘

Good luck to all, and may the best nerd win!! #Excelsior #Marvel #CableTV

El actor Chris Hemsworth, quien ha interpretado a Thor en ocho películas para el Universo Cinematográfico de Marvel, utilizó Instagram para dar la bienvenida al estudio a Ryan Reynolds al “mundo mágico”.

Chris Hemsworth da la bienvenida a Ryan Reynolds a Disney

Con la fusión de Disney / Fox hecha una realidad, Marvel ha ganado los derechos de la mayoría de sus personajes, entre ellos a Deadpool.

El actor Chris Hemsworth, quien ha interpretado a Thor en ocho películas para el Universo Cinematográfico de Marvel, utilizó Instagram para dar la bienvenida al estudio a Ryan Reynolds al “mundo mágico”.

Recordemos incluso que según los rumores Deadpoolsería el…
